length.title: Length
length.description: Horizontal length of the runway in tiles.

openEnd.title: Number of Open Ends
openEnd.description: The number of open ends in the runway. An open end is a runway edge that ends in a dropoff rather than a wall. Each open end adds a bit of extra room.

gentleUpTiles.title: Gentle Up Tiles
gentleUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) upwards

gentleDownTiles.title: Gentle Down Tiles
gentleDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) downwards

steepUpTiles.title: Steep Up Tiles
steepUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) upwards

steepDownTiles.title: Steep Down Tiles
steepDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) downwards

link.description: From & to nodes ID where the strat begins and ends.

items.title: Node ID
items.description: ID of node within this room where the strat begins or ends

reusableRoomwideNotable.description: Reference to a roomwide reusable strat. Must match the name of a reusableRoomwideNotable in the room.

comeInNormally.title: Come In Normally
comeInNormally.description: Represents a requirement to come into the room through this door, with no other particular requirements.

comeInRunning.title: Come In Running
comeInRunning.description: Represents a requirement to run in through this door with speed in a specified range.

speedBooster.title: Speed Booster
speedBooster.description: Whether or not this run should be performed with Speed Booster.

minTiles.title: Minimum Speed in Tiles
minTiles.description: The minimum horizontal speed that will satisfy this cross-room requirement, measured in effective runway tiles with dash held.

maxTiles.title: Maximum Speed in Tiles
maxTiles.description: The maximum horizontal speed that will satisfy this cross-room requirement, measured in effective runway tiles with dash held.

comeInJumping.title: Come In Jumping
comeInJumping.description: Represents a requirement that Samus come in by jumping through the door transition.

speedBooster.title: Speed Booster
speedBooster.description: Whether or not this run should be performed with Speed Booster.

minTiles.title: Minimum Speed in Tiles
minTiles.description: The minimum horizontal speed that will satisfy this condition, measured in effective runway tiles with dash held.

maxTiles.title: Maximum Speed in Tiles
maxTiles.description: The maximum horizontal speed that will satisfy this condition, measured in effective runway tiles with dash held.

comeInShinecharging.title: Come in Shinecharging
comeInShinecharging.description: Represents a requirement to run into the room with enough space to complete a shinecharge in this room.

length.title: Length
length.description: Length of the runway in the current room that can be used to complete the shinecharge.

openEnd.title: Number of Open Ends
openEnd.description: The number of open ends in the runway. An open end is a runway edge that ends in a dropoff rather than a wall. Each open end adds a bit of extra room.

gentleUpTiles.title: Gentle Up Tiles
gentleUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) upwards (when running away from the door)

gentleDownTiles.title: Gentle Down Tiles
gentleDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) downwards (when running away from the door)

steepUpTiles.title: Steep Up Tiles
steepUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) upwards (when running away from the door)

steepDownTiles.title: Steep Down Tiles
steepDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) downwards (when running away from the door)

comeInShinecharged.title: Come in Shinecharged
comeInShinecharged.description: Fulfilled by coming in through this door with a shinespark charge that has at least the given number of frames remaining.

framesRequired.title: Frames Required
framesRequired.description: The minimal number of frames that must be left on the shinespark charge when coming in.

comeInShinechargedJumping.title: Come in Shinecharged and Jumping
comeInShinechargedJumping.description: Fulfilled by jumping through this door from an air room, with a shinespark charge that has at least the given number of frames remaining.

framesRequired.title: Frames Required
framesRequired.description: The minimal number of frames that must be left on the shinespark charge when coming in.

comeInWithSpark.title: Come In With Spark
comeInWithSpark.description: Represents a requirement that Samus come in by shinesparking through the door.

position.description: Required position in the doorway while entering.

comeInStutterShinecharging.title: Come In Stutter Shinecharging
comeInStutterShinecharging.description: Represents that Samus must run through this door with SpeedBooster equipped, immediately after stuttering in the previous room (which must have normal physics). This can be used to set up a short water shinecharge.

minTiles.title: Minimum Speed in Tiles
minTiles.description: The minimum amount of effective runway tiles in other room needed for this strat.

comeInWithBombBoost.title: Come In With Bomb Boost
comeInWithBombBoost.description: Represents that Samus must come through this door with a horizontal bomb boost.

comeInWithDoorStuckSetup.title: Come In With Door Stuck Setup
comeInWithDoorStuckSetup.description: Represents that Samus must come through this door in a way that allows getting stuck in the door (e.g. to set up an X-ray climb).

comeInSpeedballing.title: Come In Speedballing
comeInSpeedballing.description: Represents that Samus must enter the room either in a speedball from the previous room, or in a process of running, jumping, or falling into a speedball.

runway.description: Runway in the current room that is available to complete the speedball.

comeInWithTemporaryBlue.title: Come In With Temporary Blue
comeInWithTemporaryBlue.description: Represents that Samus must come in by jumping through this door with temporary blue.

comeInWithStoredFallSpeed.title: Come in With Stored Fall Speed
comeInWithStoredFallSpeed.description: Represents that Samus has stored a high vertical fall speed value that will clip through the floor with the next use of Moonfall.

fallSpeedInTiles.title: Fall Speed in Tiles
fallSpeedInTiles.description: The number of tiles Samus would clip through by Moonfalling on top of a solid floor.

comeInWithRMode.title: Come in With R-Mode
comeInWithRMode.description: Represents that Samus must obtain R-mode coming through this door.

comeInWithGMode.title: Come in With G-Mode
comeInWithGMode.description: Represents that Samus must have or obtain G-mode coming through this door.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Whether we must come in with direct G-mode, indirect G-mode, or either

morphed.title: Artificial Morph
morphed.description: If true, then the strat assumes entering in a morphed state, either with artificial morph or by having Morph collected.

mobility.title: Mobility
mobility.description: Whether Samus must come in mobile, immobile, or either.

comeInWithWallJumpBelow.description: Represents that Samus must come up through this door with momentum by wall-jumping in the door frame below.

minHeight.description: Minimum height of door frame (tiles below the transition tiles) that will satisfy the condition.

comeInWithSpaceJumpBelow.description: Represents that Samus must come up through this door with momentum by using Space Jump in the door frame below.

comeInWithPlatformBelow.description: Represents that Samus must come up through this door with momentum by jumping from a platform below, possibly with run speed.

minHeight.description: Minimum height of the platform that will satisfy the condition.

maxHeight.description: Maximum height of the platform that will satisfy the condition.

maxLeftPosition.description: Maximum value of the platform leftPosition that will satisfy the condition.

minRightPosition.description: Minimum value of the platform rightPosition that will satisfy the condition.

comeInWithGrappleTeleport.description: Represents that Samus must come into the room while grappling, teleporting Samus to a position in this room corresponding to the location of the (grapple) block in the other room.

blockPositions.description: A list of tile coordinates of (grapple) blocks that Samus could be grappled to while exiting the other room.

items.description: Coordinates of a (grapple) block that Samus could be grappled to while exiting the other room.
X or Y coordinate measured as a tile count, with 0 representing the top or left-most tile of the other room.

comesThroughToilet.description: For a strat having an entranceCondition through a vertical transition, indicates whether the strat is applicable if the Toilet comes between this room and the room with the exitCondition.

requires.title: Strat Requirements
requires.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements to execute this strat.

leaveNormally.title: Leave Normally
leaveNormally.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door in a 'normal' way, by walking, falling, or jumping.

leaveWithRunway.title: Leave With Runway
leaveWithRunway.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door using a runway of specified geometry. The specific way that the runway is used depends on the 'entranceCondition' in the next room.

openEnd.title: Number of Open Ends
openEnd.description: The number of open ends in the runway. An open end is a runway edge that ends in a dropoff rather than a wall. Each open end adds a bit of extra room.

gentleUpTiles.title: Gentle Up Tiles
gentleUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) upwards (when running towards the door)

gentleDownTiles.title: Gentle Down Tiles
gentleDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that gently slope (half a vertical tile) downwards (when running towards the door)

steepUpTiles.title: Steep Up Tiles
steepUpTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) upwards (when running towards the door)

steepDownTiles.title: Steep Down Tiles
steepDownTiles.description: Number of tiles in the runway that steeply slope (one vertical tile) downwards (when running towards the door)

startingDownTiles.title: Starting Down Tiles
startingDownTiles.description: Number of tiles at the start of the runway (away from the door) that slope down, preventing a stutter

leaveShinecharged.title: Leave Shinecharged
leaveShinecharged.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door with a shinespark charge.

framesRemaining.title: Frames Remaining
framesRemaining.description: The number of frames remaining in the shinespark charge when leaving the room.

leaveWithSpark.title: Leave With Spark
leaveWithSpark.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door with a shinespark.

position.description: Possible positions in the doorway while exiting.

leaveWithStoredFallSpeed.title: Leave With Stored Fall Speed
leaveWithStoredFallSpeed.description: Represents that Samus has stored a high vertical fall speed value that will clip through the floor with the next use of Moonfall.

fallSpeedInTiles.title: Fall Speed in Tiles
fallSpeedInTiles.description: The number of tiles Samus would clip through by Moonfalling on top of a solid floor.

leaveWithGModeSetup.title: Leave With G-Mode Setup
leaveWithGModeSetup.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door while taking damage through the transition, in a pose that would allow using X-Ray on the first frame after the transition. This is for setting up to enter R-mode or direct G-mode in the next room.

knockback.title: Leaves With Knockback
knockback.description: If true, then Samus gets knockback frames through the transition.

leaveWithGMode.title: Leave With G-Mode
leaveWithGMode.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door while in G-mode, resulting in indirect G-mode in the next room.

morphed.title: Morphed
morphed.description: If true, then this strat results in leaving the room in a morphed state, either by maintaining artificial morph or by having the Morph item.

leaveWithDoorFrameBelow.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door with a jump in the door frame, e.g. using a wall-jump or Space Jump.

height.description: The number of tiles beneath the door transition usable for wall-jumping.

leaveWithPlatformBelow.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door by jumping from a platform below, possibly with run speed.

height.description: The number of tiles between the door transition and the platform. A horizontal slope tile counts as a half tile.

leftPosition.description: Position of the left end of the platform, measured as the number of tiles to the right of the center of the door. An open end should be represented as an extra half tile.

rightPosition.description: Position of the right end of the platform, measured as the number of tiles to the right of the center of the door. An open end should be represented as an extra half tile.

leaveWithGrappleTeleport.description: Represents that Samus can leave through this door while grappling, which can enable a teleport in the next room.

blockPositions.description: A list of tile coordinates of (grapple) blocks that Samus could be grappled to while exiting the room.

items.description: Coordinates of a (grapple) block that Samus could be grappled to while exiting the room.
X or Y coordinate measured as a tile count, with 0 representing the top or left-most tile of the room.

gModeRegainMobility.description: Indicates that this strat allows Samus, after entering with G-mode immobile, to regain mobility (by taking knockback from an enemy) while staying in G-mode.

bypassesDoorShell.description: Indicates that this strat allows Samus to exit through the door transition without first unlocking or opening the door.

unlocksDoors.description: List of possible doors that can be unlocked as part of this strat.

nodeId.description: Node ID of the door which can be unlocked by this strat. If omitted, it is assumed to be the destination node of the strat.

types.description: Types of doors which can be unlocked as part of this strat, with the requirements given in this object.

requires.description: Logical requirements needed to unlock this door if it is of a matching type.

useImplicitRequires.description: Whether standard requirements should be implicitly appended to the `requires`.

clearsObstacles.title: Clears Obstacles
clearsObstacles.description: The IDs of obstacles that are cleared (if not already cleared) by executing this strat.

resetsObstacles.title: Resets Obstacles
resetsObstacles.description: The IDs of obstacles that are reset (i.e. returned to their original not-cleared state) by executing this strat.

failures.title: Strat Failures
failures.description: A list of ways the strat can be failed, with the consequences of that failure.

name.title: Failure Name
name.description: A name that identifies this strat failure.

leadsToNode.title: Leads to Node
leadsToNode.description: Indicates a node at which Samus ends up when this failure happens.

cost.title: Failure Cost
cost.description: Cost of having this failure happen. This is represented as logical requirements, but only resource requirements make sense - not items or techs.

softlock.title: Softlock
softlock.description: Indicates whether this failure causes a softlock. If missing, this should be viewed as false.

physics.title: Physics
physics.description: Indicates a kind of SuperMetroid physics

$schema.title: JSON Schema Path
$schema.description: A path to the definition of this file's JSON schema.

id.title: Room ID
id.description: Identifier for this room, unique across the entire game

name.title: Room Name
name.description: As it appears in the SuperMetroid.run wiki

playable.title: Playable
playable.description: Indicates whether any gameplay happens in this room. When this is false, inputs do nothing and momentum is carried over from the previous room to the next one.

roomEnvironments.title: Room Environments
roomEnvironments.description: An array of objects that describe the room's environment in certain circumstances. In most cases there's only one that's relevant all the time.

items.title: Room Environment
items.description: An object that describes the room-wide portion of the game environment, which can optionally depend on what node Samus entered from.

heated.title: Heated
heated.description: Indicates whether the room is heated

entranceNodes.title: Entrance Nodes
entranceNodes.description: The nodes from which Samus must have entered the room for this environment to be applicable. Can be left null if applicable for all nodes.

nodes.title: Nodes; Doors, Elevators, Item Locations, etc

name.title: Node Name
name.description: A name, unique across the entire game, that identifies this node
examples: Landing Site Top Left Door (to Gauntlet)

nodeType.title: Node Type
nodeType.description: Examples: door, elevator, event, eye, gray, green, item, vertical

nodeItem.title: Vanilla Item
nodeItem.description: Item that normally resides at this node in Vanilla

doorEnvironments.title: Door Environments
doorEnvironments.description: An array of objects that describe the door's environment in certain circumstances. In most cases there's only one that's relevant all the time. This contains portions of the environment that are not room-wide.

items.title: Door Environment
items.description: An object that describes the portion of the game environment that can vary by door. This can optionally depend on what node Samus entered from.

physics.description: Indicates what kind of physics are active at this door

entranceNodes.title: Entrance Nodes
entranceNodes.description: The nodes from which Samus must have entered the room for this environment to be applicable. Can be left null if applicable for all nodes.

useImplicitDoorUnlocks.description: Whether a standard strat should implicitly be included for unlocking this node if it is a door node.

interactionRequires.title: Interaction Requirements
interactionRequires.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements to interact with this node once it has been reached. This is separate from one-time unlock requirements.

spawnAt.title: Node to spawn at
spawnAt.description: ID of the node at which Samus spawns when entering a room through this node. If this is null, Samus just spawns at the node she entered through

locks.title: Node Locks
locks.description: An array of corresponding lock and unlock conditions for this node

items.title: Lock Object
items.description: Contains corresponding lock and unlock conditions for a node. If lock condition is missing, the lock is initially active.

lock.title: Lock Requirements
lock.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements for this node to be locked

name.title: Lock Name
name.description: A name to describe the lock. Should be unique across ALL locks.

unlockStrats.title: Unlock Strats
unlockStrats.description: An array of strats that can be used to unlock the lock.

yields.description: A list of flags that are activated by unlocking with this lock.

twinDoorAddresses.title: Twin Door Addresses
twinDoorAddresses.description: The in-game address of other doors that should always lead to the same destination as this door

items.title: Twin Door Address
items.description: The room and door address of a door that should always lead to the same destination as this door

utility.title: Utilities
utility.description: Helping stations at this Node (such as save, refills, or map station)

viewableNodes.title: Viewable Item Nodes
viewableNodes.description: An array of objects describing what item nodes can be viewed from this node, and how.

items.title: Viewable Node Object
items.description: Describes what item nodes can be viewed from this node, and how.

id.title: The ID of the item node that is viewable, within the room.

strats.title: Viewable Node Strats
strats.description: An array of strats that can be executed to view the item.

yields.description: A list of flags that are activated by interacting with this node.

from.title: This Link originates at this Node ID within the Room

to.title: This Link terminates at this Node ID within the Room

id.title: Target Node ID within the Room

strats.title: Room Strats
strats.description: An array of strats that can be used in this room.

obstacles.title: Obstacles; Things that block your way and can be destroyed, not respawning until the room is reset

id.title: Obstacle ID within Room. To reduce confusion with nodes, this should be a one-letter String

obstacleType.title: Obstacle Type
obstacleType.description: The main type of obstacle. Examples include 'inanimate', 'enemies', and 'abstract'

enemies.title: Enemies; Things that try to kill you.

id.title: ID
id.description: A short identifier, which can be used to reference this enemy group from within the room but which isn't unique across the whole game.

groupName.title: Group name
groupName.description: A name that identifies this enemy group uniquely across the entire game.

enemyName.title: Enemy name
enemyName.description: The name of the enemy that this enemy group contains.

homeNodes.title: Home Nodes
homeNodes.description: At what nodes enemies normaly engage you

betweenNodes.title: Enemies between nodes
betweenNodes.description: Enemies can only be reached while traveling between these two nodes

spawn.title: Spawn Requirements
spawn.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements for this enemy to spawn. If null, enemy can spawn from game start.

stopSpawn.title: Stop Spawning Requirements
stopSpawn.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements for this enemy to stop spawning. If null, enemy can always spawn once its spawn requirements have been met.

dropRequires.title: Drop Requires
dropRequires.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements that are needed to obtain the drop from this enemy without taking any damage. These go on top of what's needed to reach and kill the enemy.

farmCycles.title: Farm Cycles
farmCycles.description: Only for respawning enemy groups. A list of objects, each of which describes requirements to farm this group of enemies as well as duration of a farm cycle.

name.title: Cycle Name
name.description: A name to identify this farming cycle. Only needs to be unique within the enemy group, not globally, and comparable farming cycles executions on different enemy groups should share the same name.

cycleFrames.title: Cycle Frames
cycleFrames.description: The number of frames between two full sets of drop pickups for this farming cycle.

requires.title: Farming Cycle Requirements
requires.description: Equipment, tech, and flag requirements to perform this type of farm.

note.title: Strat Description
note.description: A common description for all strats that use this reusable strat
